"data": {"content": "TITLE: AI Persistent Memory: Chunking and Metadata Specification

AI Persistent Memory: Chunking and Metadata Specification
This document defines the exact chunking and metadata specification for storing
conversation or document data in the persistent memory system. This ensures all stored
data is AI-friendly and supports fast, accurate retrieval.
1. Chunking Rules
1.1 Maximum Chunk Size: 1,000–1,200 characters (including spaces). This size is small
enough for AI models to process without truncation, while large enough to preserve
context.
1.2 Natural Breaks: Always split at paragraph or sentence boundaries where possible. Avoid
breaking mid-sentence.
1.3 Overlap: Include a 10–15 word overlap between consecutive chunks to preserve
continuity.
1.4 Tagging Within Chunks: Tag each chunk with conversation ID, date/time, topic, and
sequence number.
2. Metadata Specification
Each chunk must have a metadata object stored alongside the text in JSON format. This
metadata supports filtering, search maps, and relevance scoring.
Example metadata structure:
{
"conversation_id": "uuid",
"source": "chatgpt",
"date": "2025-08-10T14:32:00Z",
"topic": "rain_garden_marketing_plan",
"sequence": 3,
"chunk_text": "Actual chunk content here..."
}
3. Processing Flow
Step 1 – Ingest:
- Accept raw document or conversation transcript.
- Assign a unique conversation ID.
Step 2 – Chunk:
- Apply the chunking rules above.
- Generate sequence numbers starting at 1.
Step 3 – Metadata Attach:

- Generate metadata JSON for each chunk.\
